section.title: Common Server Configuration
section.para: These settings apply to all three server configurations.

section.title: DiffieHellmanKeyPair
section.para: This is the public key pair used for encrypting new client connections. Leave this option out and the server will generate a new pair for your server to add to the configuration.

section.title: Port
section.para: Main port for the server to listen for connections on. For the lobby and channel these should be open to the internet for clients. For the world server this port should be blocked by your firewall. For the lobby this is usually 10666. For the channel this is usually 14666, 15666, etc. For the world this is usually 18666.

section.title: DatabaseType
section.para: The type of database being used. Must be either MARIADB or SQLITE3. MARIADB is strongly recommended for production servers and testing.

section.title: MultithreadMode
section.para: Just leave it on unless your computer is an 8086.

section.title: DataStore
section.para: Location of the game data directory.

section.title: DataStoreSync
section.para: This feature is not implemented yet but it would sync the data store between servers (if they were on different systems and need this).

section.title: LogFileTimestamp
section.para: Indicates if the log file should include timestamps.

section.title: LogFileAppend
section.para: Appends to an existing log file if it exists. If disabled, the log file is replaced.

section.title: LogLevels
section.para: Map of log categories to log level. Each category can be set to DEBUG, INFO, WARNING, ERROR or CRITICAL. Messages at the set level or more critical level(s) will be logged. For example, a level of WARNING will log messages at the ERROR and CRITICAL level as well.

section.title: LogRotation
section.para: Indicates if the logs should be rotated on a periodic basis.

section.title: LogCompression
section.para: Indicates if the logs should be compressed when rotated.

section.title: LogRotationCount
section.para: Indicates the number of rotated logs to keep. A negative value will keep all rotated logs.

section.title: LogRotationDays
section.para: Indicates the number of days before the logs will be rotated.

section.title: CapturePath
section.para: Directory to store packet captures of client sessions. If this is empty, client sessions are not saved.

section.title: ServerConstantsPath
section.para: Path to the server constants.xml file. If this is blank it defaults to the same directory as the lobby, world and channel config files.
